Description: Wooden game-board/box, with drawer at one end. The upper surface is marked out in raised relief with twenty squares, arranged as a block of twelve at one end, and a central line of eight at the opposite end. This was probably intended for playing the 'Game of Twenty Squares'. On the base, 36 squares are delineated in red paint.
Curator's comments: Discussed: EB Pusch, in I L Finkel (ed), Ancient Board Games in Perspective (London 2007), 71.
Bibliographic references: Marseille 1991 / Jouer dans l'Antiquite (cat.257, pp.149, 199, fig.140)
